title: simnet
author: simnet
created_time: July 10, 2023, 07:35:15 AMLast edit: July 10, 2023, 07:51:57 PM by simnet
content: Hi colleagues. I use the "Blockchaininfo" as a source of the current BTC/USD rate in electrum. Usually, the info changes once a min or so. But now, I see the rate is not changing for the last 2 days at least. If I change the source to the Coinbase or Kraken, everything goes fine, the data changes dynamically. What could this be? The wallet version is 4.1.5p.s. Please advice what rate data source (from the electrum preinstalled list) is more close to the market average

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: Quote from: simnet on July 10, 2023, 07:35:15 AMWhat could this be? The wallet version is 4.1.5Update your Electrum. The latest version is 4.4.5. Update it and see if there would be changes.https://electrum.org/#downloadQuote from: simnet on July 10, 2023, 07:35:15 AMp.s. Please advice what rate data source (from the electrum preinstalled list) is more close to the market averageThe BTC/USD rate data sourceYou can use any. Exchanges do not have the same bitcoin price, there will always be slightly little difference in price. Use the one that you prefer.

comments.author: nc50lc
comments.body: Quote from: simnet on July 10, 2023, 07:35:15 AMBut now, I see the rate is not changing for the last 2 days at least. If I change the source to the Coinbase or Kraken, everything goes fine, the data changes dynamically. What could this be? The wallet version is 4.1.5Electrum are querying the fiat price from those API/Exchanges using this code.github.com/spesmilo/electrum/blob/master/electrum/exchange_rate.py#L273-L277The sources are same in versions 4.4.5 and 4.1.5.From it, Blockchain, Coinbase and Kraken's USD tickers are very close to each other and all of them periodically update (tickers used by Electrum):https://blockchain.info/tickerhttps://api.coinbase.com/v2/exchange-rates?currency=BTC (downloadable json file)https://api.kraken.com/0/public/Ticker?pair=BTCUSDI'm not sure what's causing the issue but if there's a connection error to the API, the fiat value would've been unavailable.But if you check Blockchain.info's market price chart, it's quite stable within these past two days.
